text: Well, definitely Link's Awakening assets right there. :p

text: This looks so much like Link's Awakening (and kinda sounds like it). I always did love Bomberman too. Think I may need to find it...

text: Is it just me or does every bomberman game have brilliant music
author: jedijadon1369

text: @Sephiko Was Dynablaster one of those Bomberman GB games? The one in which you must save "kids" through 9+1 worlds? Great game...
author: Carlos Pozo

text: I remember Dynablaster as a colorful DOS-game. My fondest bomberman memories come from that title. It had scrolling levels.
author: BeleuchteteBrueder

text: It was a very good thing.
author: King1N

text:
Is that some Zelda engine for GBC? Not that it is uncommon within Nintendo system games. Fire Emblem and Advance Wars more or less have the same engine (although the same producer), and my sister just bought a game called The Shaman King which at a glance looks exactly like Castlevania for GBA, right down to the menus. I say... Rather have games use the bases of other good games than other bad games. 

I mean, since when would a Zelda-esque Bomberman game be a bad thing?
author: TheDeejay01

text: Yeah this game is awsome and the music is so NICE!
author: SesaruMKM

text: It looks like Zelda, but that's just good since Zelda games is some of the best games ever
author: JFK piano

text: Most epic Bomberman music I've ever heard. But I do agree that the game looks an awful lot like Link's Awakening
author: Sean Saunders

text: Looks like Zelda on Gameboy, Except it has bomber-man. <_<
author: Fransinn3

text: Ah, now HERE'S an obscure game.  With that said it's probably one of my favourite Zelda formula games on any platforms; somehow it just works so well and feels original and challenging, despite how small the game's world actually is - there's always more to find and do, it seems.
author: Garlyle Wilds

text: Looks like some good graphics for the Gameboy Color, and like a Zelda clone.
author: dx619hey

text: I have 2 Bomberman games on my Game Boy (one of them was my first GB game ever) and yet I've never heard of this one.
author: Sephiko

text: Looks wrong. XD I cannot imagine B-Man at such a location compared to all the other games I've played with him.
author: Vordox

text: Looks like Bomberman was an unlockable in Link's Awakening... oh wait! :P I've always loved those graphics so it was a nice surprise to see this game using them. I've played it a long time ago but I remember having some good fun.
